jeopardy_round: THEY NAMED A SCHOOL FOR ME
THE NEW YORK TIMES MOVIE REVIEWS

(1, 1).clue: The university named for this religious leader has campuses in Provo, Utah & in Hawaii

(2, 1).clue: On D-Day during WWII, Allied forces landed on the beaches of this French region

(3, 1).clue: This liquid that circulates in the vascular systems of trees contains dissolved sugars & mineral salts

(6, 1).clue: Emma Stone & Ryan Gosling star in this charming musical whose title is "a quaint old name for Los Angeles"

(1, 2).clue: It's the school in Lexington, Virginia named for the two men seen here

(2, 2).clue: France's national anthem got its name because troops from this city loved it

(3, 2).clue: To make a fluid thinner or weaker by adding another liquid is to do this

(6, 2).clue: "Innocence is the central idea...of 'Billy Lynn's Long Halftime Walk'", about a soldier deployed in this country in 2004

(1, 3).clue: An arts patron & son of French immigrants gave his name to this school that's located at Lincoln Center in New York

(2, 3).clue: Robespierre ruled as a virtual dictator during this troubled period from 1793 to 1794

(3, 3).clue: Dew is the result of this process, the changing of a gas to a liquid

(6, 3).clue: This sci-fi film "has ideas & hope, as well as eerie extraterrestrials who face off with" linguist Amy Adams

(1, 4).clue: A Union officer & head of the Freedman's Bureau gave his name to this historically black university in Washington, D.C.

(2, 4).clue: After an 1870-71 war with this leading German kingdom, France lost parts of Alsace & Lorraine

(3, 4).clue: Consomme is a French term for this clear soup of chicken or beef flavoring

(6, 4).clue: "There is a blazing light at the center of the interplanetary romance 'Passengers', and its name is" her

(1, 5).clue: A director of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad, on his death in 1873, he left $7 million to found a university & hospital

(2, 5).clue: In November 2016 a show by Sting reopened this Paris concert hall 1 year after a terrorist attack

(3, 5).clue: Another word for smoked fish is also the abbreviation for this rocket fuel

(6, 5).clue: The Times said the visuals in this Marvel film starring Benedict Cumberbatch "evoke the work of M.C. Escher"

(1, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows two haloed figures on the monitor.) Around 700 A.D. saints had round halos, and living people, like John VII of this holy position, got square ones

(2, 1).clue: This 13th c. Italian's memoirs of China include one of the finest European references to the Pacific Ocean

(3, 1).clue: The name of this zodiac constellation comes from a Latin word for "maiden"

(4, 1).clue: What happens to people who are ignored in a system, or to your coin that rolls through the grate

(5, 1).clue: The so-called "texts" of these Egyptian structures tell of the soul's journey to the "field of reeds"

(6, 1).clue: "Clueless gamer" Conan O'Brien hit the streets of Los Santos & died (repeatedly!) at a club in this game's "V" edition

(1, 2).clue: "Halo" is a song on her 2008 album "I Am... Sasha Fierce"

(2, 2).clue: Leif Erikson is credited as the first European to reach N. Amer., perhaps in this "dogged" region on Canada's mainland

(3, 2).clue: This planet is the brightest object in the sky after the sun & the moon

(4, 2).clue: Piscine metaphor for someone in an unfamiliar situation

(5, 2).clue: After his hammer is stolen in "The Poetic Edda", he dresses up like a woman, goes to a wedding & eats an ox & 8 salmon

(6, 2).clue: An 11th-generation countess, she uses archaeological techniques that have been confused with treasure hunting

(1, 3).clue: Known for "Watchmen", this graphic novelist came into prominence with "The Ballad of Halo Jones" in 1984

(2, 3).clue: This man for whom America is named may have discovered the mouth of the Amazon river

(3, 3).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a constellation on the monitor.) Look for the Big Dipper, then for the three pairs of stars that form the paws when tracing the entire figure of this constellation

(4, 3).clue: The dude who gets the blame, rightly or wrongly

(5, 3).clue: In "The Ramayana", Rama & Sita get a little assistance from Hanuman, a general of these creatures

(6, 3).clue: Available on PS4, "Neverwinter" is a fantasy RPG that takes place within the lore of this tabletop game

(1, 4).clue: The narrow-angle type of this eye pressure disease may result in seeing halos around lights

(2, 4).clue: To avoid a rocky crater, Neil Armstrong manually flew the Apollo 11 lunar module to this "sea"

(3, 4).clue: This largest moon of Uranus was named for the queen of the fairies in "A Midsummer Night's Dream"

(4, 4).clue: Parachuting from a failing aircraft, or rescuing a struggling company

(5, 4).clue: In a 14th c. tale Gawain causes the Green Knight to lose this, but he picks it up & rides off anyway

(6, 4).clue: You'll receive mercy from Mercy in this game, and maybe, just maybe, you'll get the play of the game

(1, 5).clue: In the eclipse here, we see the halo that's the sun's outer atmosphere, known by this 6-letter term

(2, 5).clue: In the 500s B.C. Scylax sailed the length of this longest river of Pakistan to the Arabian Sea and beyond

(3, 5).clue: By the mid-'90s Carolyn Shoemaker had discovered more of these than anyone else alive, including Shoemaker-Levy 9

(4, 5).clue: If you're just like one of your parents, sometimes we say "the apple doesn't" do this

(5, 5).clue: The feasting hall is happy for a while after this title Geat rips the arm off a monster; then the monster's mom shows up

(6, 5).clue: "Hyrule Legends" & "Link's Crossbow Training" are Wii options in this "legendary" game series

(0, 0).clue: In August 2015 3 retired Marines helped raise the U.S. flag in this city where they'd hauled it down 54 years earlier
